title: Continuous Human Factors Improvement
content: Human factors is not a one-time design exercise but ongoing attention to how people actually work within systems. Conditions change, technology evolves, and new failure modes emerge. Organizations that continuously monitor and improve human-system fit outperform those that design and forget.

mcq.question: After implementing human factors improvements, performance is good. What should happen?

options.A: Move to other prioritiesâ€”the problem is solved
options.B: Continue monitoring because conditions change and new issues emerge
options.C: Document success and close the project
options.D: Human factors work is complete once implemented

mcq.explanation: Systems drift, people change, conditions evolve. Today's good design becomes tomorrow's error trap as context shifts. Continuous monitoring, feedback collection, and improvement maintain human-system fit over time.

openQuestions: How does your organization monitor human factors issues over time?
What process exists for continuously improving human-system fit?
